meanings.definition: Of or relating to the North or South Pole.
meanings.sent1: The polar bears live in the cold regions near the poles.
meanings.sent2: The explorers faced harsh polar conditions during their journey.
meanings.sent3: The penguins threw a polar party to celebrate the icy weather.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a polar opposite, always attracting and repelling.
meanings.sent5: The polar landscape was a breathtaking sight of snow and ice.

meanings.definition: Directly opposite in character or tendency.
meanings.sent1: Their opinions on the matter were polar opposites.
meanings.sent2: The siblings had polar personalities, one outgoing and the other shy.
meanings.sent3: The polar reactions to the news made for an interesting discussion.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful demeanor was a polar contrast to his somber mood.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with a polar mix of excitement and nervousness.

meanings.sent1: The equator lies between the two polars of the Earth.
meanings.sent2: The globe shows the polars as the top and bottom points.
meanings.sent3: The spaceship aimed for the distant polars of the galaxy.
meanings.sent4: The compass needle pointed towards the magnetic polars.
meanings.sent5: The map highlighted the polars as the farthest points from each other.
